main event: Multiple sightings of a grey, flat, and round object were reported in Gulfport, Mississippi, in December 1954. The object appeared to be hovering, rotating, and displaying erratic movements before disappearing from view.
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple witnesses and appeared to hover and rotate on a vertical axis at high RPM.
It was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 500-600 mph.
One witness described the object as about 30 feet in diameter and maneuvering erratically over the city for about 20 minutes, emitting no light.
The object was believed to be a meteor or a natural phenomena by the investigating authorities.
Colonel George A. Elliott, a Deputy District Engineer, observed a bright colored object moving rapidly across the sky and was unable to determine its exact nature.
sighted object: grey, flat, and round object with erratic movements
